Board of Trustees - Miles Community College Admissions Academics Student Life About Us Athletics Alumni Giving TOOLS & QUICK LINKS College Resources Human Resources Student Consumer Information Staff Directory Maps & Directions Students Canvas Login Banner Self Serve Counseling Services Financial Aid Bookstore Cancelled Classes Student eMail Activities & Clubs Accreditation Notices of Accreditation Accreditation Evaluations Mission Stmt./Core Themes Vision 2028 Faculty & Staff Resources Faculty & Staff Page Printer version Events Cafe News Board of Trustees Tara Andrews, Chair Garret McFarland, Vice Chair Jeff Okerman, Secretary Debbie Morford Jenna Janshen Ryan Jones Jamie Ogolin Previous Trustees Trustees Login Board of Trustee Meeting Room 106 at 5:30 PM Board of Trustee Retreat November 5, 2024 Miles City Hotel & Suites, 8:00 a.m. Finance Committee Jamie Ogolin - Chair Debbie Morford Ryan Jones Meets on the Wednesday prior to the Board of Trustee meeting of each month at 3:30 in the Conference Room. Human Resources Committee Jeff Okerman – Chair Garret McFarland Jamie Ogolin Meets the fourth Monday of each month at 4:00 in the Conference Room unless the Board of Trustee meeting date has been changed. Quality Committee Jenna Janshen – Chair Jeff Okerman Ryan Jones Meets on the Wednesday prior to the Board of Trustee meeting of each month at 3:30 in the Conference Room. Trustee Profiles Debbie Morford: Ms. Morford was elected to the Board of Trustees in 2013.  Debbie recently retired after working as the Manager of the Miles City Field Office with the Bureau of Land Management with responsibility for overseeing public lands and resources in 17 counties in eastern Montana.  During her 26 year career working for the federal government, Debbie also served as District Ranger, geologist, and firefighter for the U.S. Forest Service in Wyoming, Colorado, Utah, and Montana.  She also worked as a geologist for the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers in Louisiana and as a cartographer for the Department of Defense in Washington DC.  She currently works for OptiBlend Industries which provides product and support to the oil and gas industry.  Debbie received her Bachelor of Science degree in Geology from Colorado State University. Go to top of page Ryan Jones: Mr. Jones was elected to the Board of Trustees in 2016.  
								A native of Miles City, he currently works for Rain and Hail crop insurance as a Claims Supervisor for eastern Montana and northern Wyoming. 
								Ryan graduated with an Associate’s Degree from Northwest College in Powell and a Bachelor’s Degree from Montana State University in Bozeman. 
								Ryan also serves on the Board of Directors of OneHealth and Custer County 4-H programs. 
								He is happily married to Nicole and has two children. Go to top of page Jeff Okerman: Mr. Okerman was elected to the Board of Trustees in 2009.  He is a rancher south of Miles City.  He attended MSU Billings and has taken classes at Miles Community College. Go to top of page Garret McFarland: Dr. McFarland was elected to the Board of Trustees in 2005.  He has been a dentist in Miles City for 17 years.  After growing up in Fort Benton, MT, he received his bachelor’s degree from Carroll College and received his DDS from the University of Minnesota Dental School.  Along with being a Trustee for MCC and member of the MCC Endowment board, Garret is also active in Kiwanis, Miles City Club board, and Town and Country Club. Go to top of page Jamie Ogolin: Mr. Ogolin was elected to the Board of Trustees in 2017.  He is currently a financial advisor at Big Sky Financial in Miles City.  A Butte native, Jamie earned a Bachelor’s degree from the University of Montana and a Master’s degree from Montana State University.  In 1987, he moved to Miles City to teach science.  During his 27 years in education, he was a biology teacher, assistant principal, and principal at CCDHS.  Jamie also serves on the Custer County Educational Foundation board. He and his wife Kristy have two daughters, Tori and Alex. Jamie enjoys spending time outdoors with his family, hunting, fishing, and following his girls in their activities. Tara Andrews: Ms. Andrews was elected to the Board of Trustees in 2019.  Tara currently works as the Custer County Extension Agent in Miles City.  Tara graduated with Bachelor of Science from Montana State University in Bozeman and a Master’s of Science from the University of Nebraska in Lincoln, NE.  Tara also serves on the RSVP, Eastern Montana Industries, Custer County Educational Foundation, Custer County Transit and Custer County Fair boards.  Tara is married to Dwayne Andrews and has two daughters. Jenna Janshen: Jenna Janshen is a born-and-raised Miles City native, and is currently the Interior Designer at SDI Architects + Design, located in Miles City. Janshen has current civic affiliations with Kiwanis Club of Miles City, Milestown Community Improvements, Inc (MCI2), and USA Hockey. Janshen is an alumna of MCC with an Associate of Arts & Science degree and North Dakota State University with a Bachelor of Science in Interior Design and a minor degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management. Golf - Miles Grant Country Club HOME WHO WE ARE ACTIVITIES DINING EVENTS MEMBERSHIP REAL ESTATE CALENDAR MEMBER LOGIN Select Page Golf Information Golf Course Overview Golf Shop Info Instruction Golf Membership Prices MGCC Membership Options Golf in Stuart, FL Our challenging and perfectly manicured golf course has been known since 1972 as one of the finest in the area. The 18-hole, par-64 course sports two legitimate par-fives, five par-fours, 10 par-threes, and one hole that can play as a par-four or five. The course has only “two” lakes – actually one that wraps around the 18th hole and also borders the 17th hole. All skill levels from the senior to the junior golfer, find the course to be a challenge. Our facility will give you an enjoyable golf round in under four hours; you can ride or walk the course. There’s always a breeze! Course Overview Course was designed by Charles M. Mahannah and constructed by Mahannah & Howard Associates. Opened in 1972. A Master Improvement Plan by Sanford Golf Design in 2002. Converted to TifEagle Greens in 2003 and 2005. Total acreage: 88 Greens: 2.2 acres Tees: 1.3 acres Fairways: 18 acres Roughs: 34.5 acres Bunkers: 49 Golf Shop Information Miles Grant Country Club has three separate areas for practice or instruction. Develop your golf skills to the fullest using these practice areas. First practice hitting and analyzing your T shot. The full swing area is equipped with five hitting stations in a netted area, long and high enough to determine both direction and trajectory of full shots. Next to that we have a 40-yard short range with a small target green and practice sand bunker. You’ll find it perfect for wedge practice both in and out of the sand. Our third area is the practice putting green. Hone your skills on this large, well maintained putting green with sufficient area around it for practicing chipping and pitching. This is where players can cut strokes off their score. Instruction Need more than just practice? Our professional is eager to assist in making your efforts toward improving your game both enjoyable and rewarding. Individual half hour or one hour lessons as well as one hour small group clinics of two to four people are available. Contact the golf shop for instruction. Annual Golf Membership Prices Golf memberships are available on an Annual basis. Go to the Membership Options page for Miles Grant Country Club by Clicking Here . For more information about golf memberships, contact us at membership@milesgrant.net or 772-286-2220, ext. 108. Membership Options at Miles Grant Country Club Go to the Membership Options page for Miles Grant Country Club by Clicking Here . You can also download a Membership Application from the Membership Options page. If you have any questions about Membership email membership@milesgrant.net or call 772-286-2220 ext. 108 Miles Grant Country Club 5101 SE Miles Grant Road Stuart, Florida 34997 Tel: 772-286-2220 Fax: 772-286-3510 Who We Are Activities (MG CC Activities) Dining Events (Outside Events) Real Estate MILES GRANT COUNTRY CLUB © 2025 | PRIVACY POLICY | TERMS AND CONDITIONS | SITEMAP | HOSTED BY: SLATER STRATEGIES Skip to content Open toolbar Accessibility Tools Accessibility Tools Increase Text Increase Text Decrease Text Decrease Text Grayscale Grayscale High Contrast High Contrast Negative Contrast Negative Contrast Light Background Light Background Links Underline Links Underline Readable Font Readable Font Reset Reset

Who We Are - Miles Grant Country Club HOME WHO WE ARE ACTIVITIES DINING EVENTS MEMBERSHIP REAL ESTATE CALENDAR MEMBER LOGIN Select Page Member Guest 144 Member Guest 154 Putting Green Who We Are Contact Info Directions to Miles Grant Country Club Full Membership Newsletter | Events History of Miles Grant Country Club Community Area Wildlife Who We Are Miles Grant Country Club is a private country club located in Stuart, Florida, at East Cove Road on the shores of the Intracoastal Waterway. Members enjoy golf and tennis, swimming and kayaking, other outdoor activities, and gather for social activities in our Clubhouse. MILES GRANT COUNTRY CLUB 5101 SE Miles Grant Road, Stuart, Florida 34997 772.286.2220 Directions From I-95 South Take exit 101 for FL-76 E
Turn left onto FL-76E/SW Kanner Hwy
Take the 2nd right onto SE Cove Rd
At the traffic circle, continue straight to stay on SE Cove Rd

Take the 2nd right onto SE Cove Rd.
At the traffic circle, continue straight to stay on SE Cove Rd.
At Entrance C, turn left onto SE Miles Grant Rd. Full Membership The base membership at Miles Grant Country Club is a Social membership.  The Social membership is a family or individual membership with required food and beverage minimums.  This means that each member is required to spend the minimum in the Tavern or Dining Room during the Miles Grant fiscal year. Both the membership dues and the food and beverage minimum are pro-rated for new members. Social Membership provides access to the Club’s facilities and amenities to include the clubhouse, swimming pool, hard surface tennis courts, dining and all social related events and activities.  In addition, this membership allows limited golf twelve times in season for the standard guest fee.  These privileges are extended to the Member’s spouse (or significant other) and unmarried dependent children under the age of 21. Golf and Tennis memberships may be added to the Social membership to meet your needs. These memberships may be family or individual. Golf Membership: Access to all of the Club’s facilities and amenities included in the Social membership plus unlimited use of our 18-hole golf course, practice areas, and golf shop.  The food and beverage minimum applies. Tennis Membership: Access to all of the Club’s facilities and amenities included in the Social membership plus unlimited use of our Har-Tru tennis courts.  The food and beverage minimum applies. Prospective members please contact Jennifer Wooley at membership@milesgrant.net or call 772.286.2220, ext. 108. To view the prices of Annual Memberships for Social, Golf & Tennis at Miles Grant Country Club, click here . Newsletter | Events Each month Miles Grant Country Club publishes a Newsletter and a Calendar of events that provide information about Miles Grant Country Club, the upcoming club activities, evening menus and other information. Click Here to go to the Newsletter and Calendar of Events page where you can download the current information. You can also see the past and upcoming events at Miles Grant Country Club (including menus) right here on our website by clicking the Calendar tab at the top of the page or clicking this link to go to our Calendar page . History of Miles Grant Country Club The Miles Grant golf course opened in 1972, but the land on which it stands was part of a Spanish land grant from the King of Spain to settler Samuel Miles in 1813. Five square miles of land bordering the Santa Lucia River (now St. Lucie) was given as compensation for shipping and logistical support rendered by Miles to the Spanish territorial government. Miles originally established a sawmill on the property to produce building materials for the influx of settlers who soon followed and the colonization of the east central Florida coastal region was under way. Today, we find the established residential community of Miles Grant that provides social and recreational activities for the folks living in the houses and condominiums bordering the golf course. Stuart Area Stuart was named “The Sailfish Capital of the World” and “ 2016 America’s Happiest Seaside Town ” by Coastal Living magazine. Perfectly located on the Intracoastal Waterway along what’s known as the “Treasure Coast of Florida,” it boasts great weather for fishing, boating and other water sports. The quaint downtown area hosts fine dining, The Lyric Theatre, galleries, wonderful one-of-a-kind shops, and a Riverwalk. Not far from Stuart, on Hutchison Island, is The Elliott Museum. This unique museum features history of the Treasure Coast as well as exhibits of cars, baseball, art, and more. Across the road is the Oceanographic Coastal Center, an educational and research site featuring a lagoon of fish and turtles, a tank for observing and feeding stingrays, as well as several nature trails. Closer to the Miles Grant community is the town of Port Salerno. At the marina you can watch local fishermen come in with their catch, shop the stores where local artists exhibit their crafts, and enjoy good food, beverage and fellowship at your choice of several restaurants and bars. Ride your bike to nearby Sandsprit Park. Located on the St. Lucie River and Manatee Pocket, the park has pavilions and a playground for family fun and picnics, outdoor exercise stations, and a boardwalk with benches for relaxing at the water’s edge. For the fisherman, long piers stretch like fingers into the water, or you can launch your boat at the public ramps. Click Here to see a picture gallery of some of our favorite places and activities around our area. Area Wildlife We host a diverse bird population. Green parrots take over trees and ground. These gregarious birds are easily recognized by their raucous calls. A pair of Egyptian geese are often spotted along the course. A white heron wades in the water under the bridge at the 18th. A pair of Sand Hill Cranes can be seen playing fetch with a stick in the grass near the Tennis Courts. The striking White Ibis is frequently seen on lawns looking for large insects. Small mammals like squirrel, fox, raccoon, rabbit, iguana and armadillo are also in our backyards. Several Gopher Tortoise have burrows along the perimeter road that provide shelter for at least 360 other animal species. Click Here to view a gallery of local wildlife. Amazing! (When you are viewing the gallery, you can click on a picture to see the full image. Board of Directors & Staff — The Miles Foundation About Grants News Blog Contact Us Back What We Do Mission Vision Core Values About Our Founder Board of Directors & Staff The Meaning Behind Our Logo Liberty Letters Back Funding & Eligibility VELA About What We Do Mission Vision Core Values About Our Founder Board of Directors & Staff The Meaning Behind Our Logo Liberty Letters Grants Funding & Eligibility VELA News Blog Contact Us Board of Directors & Staff Grant Coates ceo & President Grant Coates has served as Chief Executive Officer and President of The Miles Foundation since 2011. Over two decades ago, Mr. Coates began his work in finance and operations management for Ellison Miles’ predecessor oil and gas business, Miles Production Company. He served in various financial and investment roles for Miles Production over the next decade, and subsequently acted as a strategic advisor to the Board of Directors in the formation of The Miles Foundation. Mr. Coates was elected to the Board of Directors for The Miles Foundation in 2009. Today, Mr. Coates is responsible for the general management of the Foundation, which includes the oversight of regulatory and legal compliance, guidance on strategic grant funding priorities, and stewardship of the Foundation’s investments. Mr. Coates leads the Foundation’s Investment Committee, serves on the Board of several of the Foundation’s portfolio companies, and ensures the organization’s fidelity to its outlined investment strategy. Mr. Coates takes immense pride in the transformative impact The Miles Foundation has on local communities through its grant initiatives and partnerships. He holds a Bachelor’s degree in Finance from the University of North Texas and an MBA from Texas Christian University. Active in community leadership, he is a member of the AEI Enterprise Club, co-founded the Fort Worth chapter of the Liberty Leadership Council, and serves on the boards of the Fort Worth Chamber of Commerce, Fort Worth Community Land Trust, and Philanthropy Advocates. Mr. Coates resides in Fort Worth, Texas, with his children, Owen and Isabel. Sherry Wilson DIRECTOR Sherry Wilson has served on the Board of Directors of The Miles Foundation since the inception of the Foundation in 1997. Ms. Wilson originally began working for Miles Production Company in 1981. In 1993, she became Corporate Secretary for the company, as well as personal secretary to Mr. Miles. As a Director at The Miles Foundation, Ms. Wilson’s role includes managing many of the administrative duties of the Foundation, as well as participating in the grant selection process. Ms. Wilson enjoys carrying on Ellison Miles’ dream of furthering education opportunities and making a positive impact on the lives of so many people, as did Mr. Miles throughout his lifetime. Ms. Wilson received her education in Duncan, Oklahoma. She currently resides in Weatherford, Texas. Jack Burdett DIRECTOR Jack Burdett has served on The Miles Foundation’s Board of Directors since the Foundation’s beginning in 1997. Mr. Burdett started working as an accountant for Ellison Miles’ oil and gas firm, Miles Production Company, in 1981. In his current position, Mr. Burdett oversees many of the day-to-day financial activities of The Miles Foundation, in addition to participating in the Foundation’s grant selection process. Mr. Burdett believes that the people at The Miles Foundation always have been genuinely dedicated to carrying out Mr. Miles’ mission, and that this passion is what propels the Foundation and enables its continued success today. Mr. Burdett earned a BBA in Accounting from the University of Oklahoma, and formerly served on the Board of Directors of the Dallas County Community College District Foundation. Mr. Burdett resides in Denton, Texas. Sara J. Redington Chief Philanthropy Officer Sara Redington is Chief Philanthropy Officer for The Miles Foundation. Ms. Redington brings nearly 20 years of strategic planning, business development, and communications experience to her role. She founded Redington Solutions in 2009, a strategy and communications firm serving businesses in Texas and across the country. Prior to that endeavor, Ms. Redington led both local and international business development efforts at the global law firm of K&L Gates. Today, she connects The Miles Foundation with its mission by spearheading strategic initiatives that amplify community impact, engaging key stakeholders in the Foundation’s whole-community approach, and aligning Foundation practices with its long-term vision for success.. Ms. Redington graduated cum laude from Vanderbilt University with a B.A. in Communications and Psychology. She lives in Dallas, Texas with her husband, Zach, and daughter, Emma Joy. Jared Harrell General Counsel Jared Harrell joined The Miles Foundation as General Counsel in 2016.  Prior to joining The Miles Foundation, Jared served as an attorney at various law firms in the DFW metroplex, where his practice focused on the successful completion of commercial transactions across a broad range of industries, including real estate, energy, agriculture, and banking.  In addition to his role as General Counsel at The Miles Foundation, Jared is the Director of the Center for Real Estate at the Rawls College of Business, Texas Tech University.  Jared is a graduate of Texas A&M University (BS, Agricultural Engineering), the University of Texas Law School (JD), and the University of Oxford (MSc, Law & Finance).  He and his wife, Leah, are the proud parents of one daughter, Hallie May. Mike McKee Chief Financial Officer Mike McKee serves as Chief Financial Officer for The Miles Foundation.  Mike is a seasoned finance professional with three decades of experience in investment banking, corporate finance, and executive level financial management, and serves on the Foundation’s Investment Committee. He earned an MBA from the University of Oklahoma and spent his first decade as a corporate lender with large U.S. and European banks. For the majority of the past twenty years, he has focused on investing and M&A activities, working both as an advisor and principal on dozens of transactions comprising an aggregate value of several billion dollars. Mike and his wife LuAnn have two adult children and reside in Tool, Texas. Bethany Maxwell Office Administrator Bethany Maxwell serves as Office Administrator for The Miles Foundation. Bethany assists the Foundation’s grantmaking and investment teams by  coordinating all office activities and providing executive support to ensure the Foundation's day-to-day operations run smoothly and efficiently. Bethany studied Communications at Dallas Baptist University. Before joining The Miles Foundation team, Bethany worked in various sales and marketing roles. She resides in her hometown of Fort Worth, Texas, and enjoys spending time with her family, friends, and Goldendoodle, Dolly. Want to learn more? Learn more about our team's work, including our key funding areas, current projects, and latest community events through our blog.
